decks.notes: The main goal of this Modern Ad Nauseam combo deck is to set up a situation where you can cast Ad Nauseam to draw your entire deck, using Angel's Grace to prevent losing the game from reaching negative life. Once you have drawn your entire deck, you can win the game by either casting Lightning Storm with enough lands in play or by playing Laboratory Maniac and drawing a card to win through its alternate win condition. The deck focuses on efficient card selection, mana ramp, and protection to assemble the combo pieces quickly and effectively.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents' spells, removing their threats, and disrupting their game plan while generating card advantage and powerful creatures through card selection and flash effects. The key strategy involves using flexible removal and countermagic spells to protect your own threats, such as Archangel Avacyn and Celestial Colonnade, while controlling the board and outvaluing opponents in the long game. Additionally, the deck utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile to deal with a variety of threats and maintain board control.

The core strategy of this deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a significant amount of mana quickly. By using cards like Expedition Map and Sylvan Scrying, the deck aims to find and play powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Emrakul, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also includes various control elements like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while building up its own board presence.

This deck focuses on early disruption through hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, paired with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Abrupt Decay to control the board. It utilizes efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional value and control over the game. The deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy to come out ahead in a tempo-driven matchup.

This deck is focused on assembling a fast and aggressive board presence by utilizing a combination of Human creatures that benefit from each other's abilities. The deck includes disruptive elements like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage to control the opponent's plays, while also utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and maintain pressure. The mana base is optimized to support the Human tribal theme, allowing for consistent creature deployment and maximizing efficiency. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a synergistic and disruptive aggro strategy.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix to bring back strong creatures like Gurmag Angler and Hollow One. By discarding cards with Burning Inquiry and Faithless Looting, the deck can quickly put creatures onto the battlefield and apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is designed to provide the necessary colors for the deck's spells while maintaining consistency.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing mana acceleration with Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple, the deck can cast threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of schedule. Chalice of the Void disrupts the opponent's game plan by shutting down low-cost spells, while cards like All Is Dust and Karn Liberated provide additional disruption and removal. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control of the game with its resilient threats and disruptive elements.

This deck aims to aggressively play and manage your life total in order to maximize the power of Death's Shadow while using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure on the opponent while leveraging graveyard synergy with cards like Thought Scour. Utilizing efficient removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats, this deck seeks to overpower opponents quickly and efficiently in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to control the game through countering spells, removal, and card advantage. It includes a mix of counterspells like Negate and Logic Knot, removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Helix, and card draw and selection tools like Serum Visions and Search for Azcanta. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Torrential Gearhulk and Nahiri, the Harbinger to close out the game. The mana base supports the deck's color requirements and includes utility lands like Celestial Colonnade for additional win conditions.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to pump up your creatures, along with disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to disrupt your opponent's plans, you can quickly establish a dominant board presence. Additionally, the use of Aether Vial allows you to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, keeping your opponent off balance and unable to properly respond to your threats.

The deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with aggressive Human creatures, using cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to grow the team. With cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, it disrupts the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure. The mana base is designed to support the Human tribe, ensuring smooth casting of creatures. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for cheating creatures into play and maximizing the efficiency of the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with a fast and disruptive aggro strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. The deck aims to control the game by using removal spells like Fatal Push and board wipes like Oblivion Stone, while also utilizing powerful threats like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck's win condition usually involves casting big Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger or utilizing the synergy between artifacts and Walking Ballista for a lethal finish.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through direct burn spells and aggressive creatures. The goal is to pressure the opponent early on and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize. With a low mana curve and a high number of burn spells, the deck aims to consistently deal damage and control the board to secure a speedy victory. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and further push the tempo in the deck's favor.

The main goal of this UR Storm combo deck is to generate a critical mass of spells and mana acceleration to storm off and win the game in one explosive turn. By utilizing cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells, alongside rituals and cantrips to generate mana and draw cards, the deck aims to cast a high storm count Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Gifts Ungiven is used to tutor for key combo pieces and Past in Flames provides recursion for multiple spell casts in a turn.

The main concept of this Affinity deck is to utilize artifact creatures and equipment to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive and efficient plays. Using cards like Arcbound Ravager, Signal Pest, Cranial Plating, and Steel Overseer, the deck aims to put immense pressure on the opponent early in the game. The deck also includes versatile lands like Inkmoth Nexus and Blinkmoth Nexus to provide different avenues of attack. With a focus on fast and explosive gameplay, this deck seeks to end the game swiftly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck revolves around controlling the game and preventing your opponent from executing their game plan. It relies on countering spells, bouncing or removing threats, and disrupting the opponent's mana base. The deck also utilizes the combo of Through the Breach and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn to quickly close out the game. Blood Moon is included to further disrupt the opponent's mana base and increase the control player's advantage. This UR Control deck aims to maintain control of the game while efficiently dealing with threats and eventually winning through a strong combo.
